title: Variable ocean.day.mlotst_tavg-u-hxy-sea (Oday.mlotst)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Thickness of the layer bounded by the depth at which potential density Sigma0 exceeds density at 10m by 0.03 kg.m-3
Long name: Ocean Mixed Layer thickness Defined by Sigma T
Processing notes: The density to be used is sigma0, referenced at the surface. The mixed layer thickness is approximated by interpolating between the model level where the density exceeds density at 10m by 0.03 kg.m-3 and the level just above.  CHANGE: dsigmat coordinate added to clarify definition.

title: Variable ocnBgchem.day.intpp_tavg-u-hxy-sea (Oday.intpp)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
Comment: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton. This should equal the sum of intpdiat+intpphymisc, but those individual components may be unavailable in some models.
Long name: Primary Organic Carbon Production by All Types of Phytoplankton

title: Variable ocnBgchem.day.intpoc_tavg-u-hxy-sea (Oday.intpoc)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
Comment: Vertically integrated POC

title: Variable ocean.day.hfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea (Oday.hfyint)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
Comment: Ocean heat y transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale. Report on native horizontal grid.
Long name: Vertically Integrated Ocean Heat Y Transport
Processing notes: 2d vertically integrated field. Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.day.hfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea (Oday.hfxint)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
Comment: Ocean heat x transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale. Report on native horizontal grid.
Long name: Vertically Integrated Ocean Heat X Transport
Processing notes: 2d vertically integrated field. Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocnBgchem.day.expcob_tavg-u-hxy-sea (Oday.expcob)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Downward sinking flux of particulate organic carbon at seafloor. Reported at the sea floor depth for present day relative to z=0 geoid. Reported as missing for land grid cells.
Long name: Sinking Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon Reaching the Ocean Bottom

title: Variable ocnBgchem.day.dissoc_tavg-l-hxy-sea (Oday.dissoc)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Sum of dissolved carbon component concentrations explicitly represented (i.e. not ~40 uM refractory unless explicit)

title: Variable ocnBgchem.day.detoc_tavg-l-hxy-sea (Oday.detoc)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: sum of detrital organic carbon component concentrations

title: Variable ocnBgchem.day.co3satarag_tavg-u-hm-sea (Oday.co3sataragos)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.
Long name: Surface Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water

title: Variable ocnBgchem.day.co3satarag_tavg-u-hxy-sea (Oday.co3satarag200)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.

title: Variable ocnBgchem.day.co3_tavg-u-hm-sea (Oday.co3os)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present

Comment: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).

In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of 'Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration' plus 'Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration'"; ; "dimensions" was "longitude latitude time";

Comment: Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea".
Processing notes: If soil layer thicknesses vary from one location to another, interpolate to a standard set of depths.  Ideally, the interpolation should preserve the vertical integral.

title: Variable land.mon.npp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Lmon.npp)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "'Production of carbon' means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ('producers'), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. 'Productivity' means production per unit area. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.
Long name: Net Primary Production on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: needed for any model that does not compute GPP

title: Variable land.mon.nbp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Lmon.nbp)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "This is the net mass flux of carbon from atmosphere into land, calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbon fluxes from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes  from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux  is into the land.
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Biospheric Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.landCoverFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u (Lmon.landCoverFrac)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Percentage of grid cell area occupied by different model vegetation/land cover categories. The categories may differ from model to model, depending on each model's subgrid land cover category definitions. Categories may include natural vegetation, anthropogenic vegetation, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, glaciers, etc. Sum of all should equal the percentage of the grid cell that is land."; ; "cell_methods" was "area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean";
Comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their  PFT definitions.   This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc.   Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid-cell that is land.
Long name: Percentage of Area by Vegetation or Land-Cover Category
Processing notes: need to explain how to define vegtype.  To facilitate model comparison, it is also requested that the aggregated land cover types called for in lines 28 to 35 be archived (but not in this variable).  Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).   Note that the "types" will be model dependent and for each type there should be a full description of the PFT (plant functional type).; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude vegtype time CMIP7:longitude latitude time vegtype,;  ; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

labels: mon land CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 BCV
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.
Processing notes: Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).

title: Variable land.mon.grassFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u (Lmon.grassFrac)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean";
Comment: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.

Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time typenatgr CMIP7:longitude latitude time  typenatgr,;  ; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

title: Variable land.mon.gpp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Lmon.gpp)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ('producers') expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. ";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.fVegSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Lmon.fVegSoil)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Carbon mass flux per unit area from vegetation directly into soil, without intermediate conversion to litter.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: In some models part of carbon (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.
Long name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil

title: Variable land.mon.fVegLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Lmon.fVegLitter)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. 'Vegetation' means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between 'fine' and 'coarse' is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_mortality and mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_senescence is mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_mortality and mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_senescence is mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation.
Long name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter

title: Variable land.mon.fLitterSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Lmon.fLitterSoil)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into soil from litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).
Long name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil

title: Variable land.mon.fHarvestToGeologicStorage_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Lmon.fHarvestToGeologicStorage)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Flux of carbon harvested from biomass that goes into geologic storage for the purposes of intentional carbon dioxide removal, via efforts such as bioenergy with carbon capture and storage (BECCS) or biomass removal and storage (BiCRS). The definition of geologic storage here is that the resulting carbon be  stored for a period of time that is long relative to that of the simulation.
Long name: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Geological Storage
Processing notes: Positive number represents a flux of carbon from biomass (down) to geologic storage.

title: Variable land.mon.fFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Lmon.fFire)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux per unit area) from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux) from natural fires + human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the DGVM, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc, defined below (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Excluding Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]

Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean

title: Variable land.mon.cLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Lmon.cLitter)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between 'fine' and 'coarse' is model dependent. 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.

title: Variable land.mon.cLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Lmon.cLeaf)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Carbon mass per unit area in leaves.

title: Variable land.mon.cGeologicStorage_tavg-u-hm-u (Lmon.cGeologicStorage)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Mass of carbon that has been intentionally sequestered in geologic storage. The definition of geologic storage here is that it be stored for periods of time that are long as compared to the simulation.
Processing notes: This variable should only contain carbon that is stored through processes that are represented by the Earth system model itself, not carbon that is stored solely on the basis of a forcing dataset. For example, if an ESM represents biomass energy with carbon capture and storage (BECCS) as a prognostic process, then the resulting carbon storage would be included here; whereas if a process like direct air capture (DAC) is represented solely as a negative carbon emissions flux in the scenario forcing dataset, then it would not be included here.

CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean";
Comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C4 PFTs (including grass and crops).
Long name: Percentage Cover by C4 Plant Functional Type
Processing notes: Note that if this variable is independent of time, it should be stored only for a single time (user choice).; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time typec4pft CMIP7:longitude latitude time  typec4pft,;  ; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

title: Variable land.mon.c3PftFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u (Lmon.c3PftFrac)

title: Variable landIce.mon.rsus_tavg-u-hxy-is (LImon.rsusIs)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";
Comment: quantity averaged over ice_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
Long name: Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Modeling Realm - CMIP6:landIce CMIP7:ocean,

title: Variable landIce.mon.snicefreez_tavg-u-hxy-is (ImonGre.snicefreez)

title: Variable landIce.mon.snc_tavg-u-hxy-is (ImonGre.snc)

title: Variable landIce.mon.sbl_tavg-u-hxy-is (ImonGre.sbl)

title: Variable landIce.mon.rsus_tavg-u-hxy-is (ImonGre.rsus)

title: Variable land.mon.orog_tavg-u-hxy-is (ImonGre.orog)

title: Variable landIce.mon.mrroLi_tavg-u-hxy-is (ImonGre.mrroLi)

title: Variable landIce.mon.licalvf_tavg-u-hxy-is (ImonGre.licalvf)

title: Variable landIce.mon.hfss_tavg-u-hxy-is (ImonGre.hfss)

title: Variable landIce.mon.hfls_tavg-u-hxy-is (ImonGre.hfls)

title: Variable landIce.mon.hfls_tavg-u-hxy-is (ImonAnt.hfls)

'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics."; ; "modeling_realm" was "landIce land";
Comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Modeling Realm - CMIP6:land, landIce CMIP7:land, ocean,

title: Variable atmos.subhr.tntscp_tpt-l-hxys-u (Esubhr.tntscp)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt"; ; "comment" was "The phrase 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name tendency_of_air_temperature_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain net latent heating effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation between water vapour, liquid or ice phases. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).";
Comment: alevel site time1
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:subhrPt CMIP7:subhr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: (m01s03i181[lbproc=0] - m01s03i189[lbproc=0] + m01s04i141[lbproc=0] + m01s04i181[lbproc=0] + m01s16i161[lbproc=0] + m01s16i181[lbproc=0] + m01s01i181[lbproc=0] - m01s01i161[lbproc=0] + m01s02i181[lbproc=0] - m01s02i161[lbproc=0] + m01s05i181[lbproc=0] - m01s05i161[lbproc=0]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP
Expression UKESM1: (m01s03i181[lbproc=0] - m01s03i189[lbproc=0] + m01s04i141[lbproc=0] + m01s04i181[lbproc=0] + m01s16i161[lbproc=0] + m01s16i181[lbproc=0] + m01s01i181[lbproc=0] - m01s01i161[lbproc=0] + m01s02i181[lbproc=0] - m01s02i161[lbproc=0] + m01s05i181[lbproc=0] - m01s05i161[lbproc=0]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP

CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt"; ; "comment" was "This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical temperature diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the temperature budget.";
Comment: alevel site time1

title: Variable atmos.subhr.tnhusscp_tpt-l-hxys-u (Esubhr.tnhusscp)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt"; ; "comment" was "The phrase 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. 'Specific' means per unit mass. Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name of tendency_of_specific_humidity_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain the effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation to or from water vapor. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).";
Comment: alevel site time1
Long name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:subhrPt CMIP7:subhr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.mon.utendogw_tavg-p39-hy-air (EmonZ.utendogw)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Zonal mean tendency of eastward wind induced by the parameterized orographic gravity wave drag
Long name: Eastward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Processing notes: This is the total tendency due to parameterized orographic gravity wave drag, which is the sum of all possible components of the parameterization (where applicable). We ask that in the Essential Model Documentation modelling centers specify the parameterization scheme used and the specific values of its tunable parameters used for the simulation, and a specification of the part of the gravity wave spectrum that is targeted by the parameterization (e.g., minimally, the effective resolution of the model).

title: Variable atmos.mon.tntscp_tavg-p39-hy-air (EmonZ.tntscp)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "longitude: mean time: mean"; ; "comment" was "The phrase 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name tendency_of_air_temperature_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain net latent heating effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation between water vapour, liquid or ice phases. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).";
Comment: zonal mean; hence YZT
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

title: Variable atmos.mon.tntmp_tavg-p39-hy-air (EmonZ.tntmp)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "longitude: mean time: mean"; ; "comment" was "Tendency of air temperature due to model physics. This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.";
Comment: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to model physics, with the extended number of vertical levels
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
Processing notes: This is the total temperature tendency due to parameterized physics, which is the sum of contributes from all relevant parameterizations. We ask that in the Essential Model Documentation modelling centers specify the parameterized process contributing to this tendency, and (where applicable) specific values of their tunable parameters used for the simulation.; ; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

title: Variable atmos.mon.tntc_tavg-p39-hy-air (EmonZ.tntc)

Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Convection

Please use the definitions given by equation 3.5.3b of Andrews, Holton and Leovy text book, but scaled by density to have units m3 s-2.";
Comment: zonal mean; hence YZT
Long name: Upward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

title: Variable atmos.mon.wsgmax_tstat-h10m-hxy-u (Emon.wsgmax10m)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 10m, monthly
Long name: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 10m
Processing notes: Maximum instantaneous gust over grid cell, recorded monthly. Input data at the highest available frequency, ideally model timesteps, should be used to compute the maximum. Modellers are requested to leave in a comment in the netcdf metadata stating the frequency of the input data.

title: Variable atmos.mon.tntscp_tavg-l-hxy-u (Emon.tntscp)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The phrase 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name tendency_of_air_temperature_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain net latent heating effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation between water vapour, liquid or ice phases. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).";
Comment: The phrase "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name tendency_of_air_temperature_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain net latent heating effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation between water vapour, liquid or ice phases. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: (m01s03i181[lbproc=128] - m01s03i189[lbproc=128] + m01s04i141[lbproc=128] + m01s04i181[lbproc=128] + m01s16i161[lbproc=128] + m01s16i181[lbproc=128] + m01s01i181[lbproc=128] - m01s01i161[lbproc=128] + m01s02i181[lbproc=128] - m01s02i161[lbproc=128] + m01s05i181[lbproc=128] - m01s05i161[lbproc=128]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP
Expression UKESM1: (m01s03i181[lbproc=128] - m01s03i189[lbproc=128] + m01s04i141[lbproc=128] + m01s04i181[lbproc=128] + m01s16i161[lbproc=128] + m01s16i181[lbproc=128] + m01s01i181[lbproc=128] - m01s01i161[lbproc=128] + m01s02i181[lbproc=128] - m01s02i161[lbproc=128] + m01s05i181[lbproc=128] - m01s05i161[lbproc=128]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP

title: Variable atmos.mon.tnhusscp_tavg-l-hxy-u (Emon.tnhusscp)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The phrase 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. 'Specific' means per unit mass. Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name of tendency_of_specific_humidity_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain the effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation to or from water vapor. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).";
Comment: The phrase "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. "Specific" means per unit mass. Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name of tendency_of_specific_humidity_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain the effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation to or from water vapor. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).
Long name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: (m01s01i182[lbproc=128] + m01s02i182[lbproc=128] + m01s03i182[lbproc=128] - m01s03i190[lbproc=128] + m01s04i142[lbproc=128] + m01s04i182[lbproc=128] + m01s05i182[lbproc=128] - m01s05i162[lbproc=128] + m01s16i162[lbproc=128] + m01s16i182[lbproc=128]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP

title: Variable land.mon.rhc14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.rhc14)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ('consumers'), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ('producers') do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.
Long name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.rhc13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.rhc13)

Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.
Long name: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.npp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.nppLut)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "'Production of carbon' means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ('producers'), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. 'Productivity' means production per unit area. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.";
Comment: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.
Long name: Net Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude time landUse,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable land.mon.nppGrass_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.nppGrass)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac)";
Comment: Total NPP of grass in the grid cell
Long name: Net Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where natural_grasses (mask=grassFrac),

title: Variable land.mon.netAtmosLandCO2Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.netAtmosLandCO2Flux)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).
Long name: Net Flux of CO2 Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.netAtmosLandC14Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.netAtmosLandC14Flux)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Flux of carbon-14 as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).
Long name: Net Mass Flux of 14C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.netAtmosLandC13Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.netAtmosLandC13Flux)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Flux of carbon 31as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).-
Long name: Net Mass Flux of 13C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.nep_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.nep)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Natural flux of CO2 (expressed as a mass flux of carbon) from the atmosphere to the land calculated as the difference between uptake associated will photosynthesis and the release of CO2 from the sum of plant and soil respiration and fire.  Positive flux is into the land.  Emissions from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change)."; ; "long_name" was "Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Ecosystem Productivity on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]";

Long name: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Land-Use Tile [kgC m-2 s-1]

CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. Comment: Upward sensible heat flux on land use tiles. The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude time landUse,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable land.mon.hfls_tavg-u-hxy-lus (Emon.hflsLut)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";
Comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
Long name: Latent Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude time landUse,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable land.mon.grassFracC4_tavg-u-hxy-u (Emon.grassFracC4)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean";
Comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 natural grass.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time typec4natg CMIP7:longitude latitude time  typec4natg,;  ; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

title: Variable land.mon.grassFracC3_tavg-u-hxy-u (Emon.grassFracC3)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean";
Comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 natural grass.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time typec3natg CMIP7:longitude latitude time  typec3natg,;  ; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

title: Variable land.mon.gppc14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.gppc14)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The rate of synthesis of carbon-14 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ('producers') expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. ";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: The rate of synthesis of carbon-14 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.
Long name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.gppc13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.gppc13)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The rate of synthesis of carbon-13 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ('producers') expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. ";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: The rate of synthesis of carbon-13 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.
Long name: Carbon-13 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.gpp_tavg-u-hxy-tree (Emon.gppTree)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac)";
Comment: Total GPP of trees in the grid cell
Long name: Gross Primary Production on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where trees (comment: mask=treeFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where trees (mask=treeFrac),

title: Variable land.mon.gpp_tavg-u-hxy-shb (Emon.gppShrub)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac)";
Comment: Total GPP of shrubs in the grid cell
Long name: Gross Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where shrubs (comment: mask=shrubFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where shrubs (mask=shrubFrac),

title: Variable land.mon.gpp_tavg-u-hxy-lus (Emon.gppLut)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ('producers') expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.";
Comment: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.
Long name: Gross Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude time landUse,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable land.mon.gpp_tavg-u-hxy-ng (Emon.gppGrass)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac)";
Comment: Total GPP of grass in the grid cell
Long name: Gross Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where natural_grasses (mask=grassFrac),

title: Variable land.mon.fracLut_tavg-u-hxy-u (Emon.fracLut)
CMIP6 Differences: "dimensions" was "longitude latitude landUse time"; ; "comment" was "End of year values (not annual mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac_lnd = 0.5, frac_ocn = 0.5, frac_crop_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac_lut(crop) = 0.5*0.2 = 0.1)"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean";
Comment: End of month values (not monthly mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac_lnd = 0.5, frac_ocn = 0.5, frac_crop_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac_lut(crop) = 0.5\*0.2 = 0.1)
Long name: Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: mean time: point,; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landUse time1,

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.flashrate_tavg-u-hxy-u (Emon.flashrate)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "proposed name: lightning_flash_rate (units to be interpreted as 'counts km-2 s-1)";
Comment: Lightning Flash Rate

title: Variable ocean.mon.flandice_tavg-u-hxy-sea (Emon.flandice)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to land ice (runoff water from surface and base of land ice or melt from base of ice shelf or vertical ice front) into the ocean divided by the area ocean portion of the grid cell
Long name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Land Ice

title: Variable ocnBgchem.mon.fg14co2_tavg-u-hxy-sea (Emon.fg14co2)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Gas exchange flux of carbon-14 as CO2 (positive into ocean)
Long name: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.fVegSoilSenescence_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fVegSoilSenescence)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
Long name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence

title: Variable land.mon.fVegSoilMortality_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fVegSoilMortality)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
Long name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Mortality

title: Variable land.mon.fVegLitterSenescence_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fVegLitterSenescence)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
Long name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence

title: Variable land.mon.fVegLitterMortality_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fVegLitterMortality)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
Long name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Mortality

title: Variable land.mon.fVegFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fVegFire)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.fProductDecomp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fProductDecomp)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of 'forestry and agricultural products' are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.
Long name: Decomposition out of Product Pools to CO2 in Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.fNup_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNup)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The uptake of nitrogen by fixation: nitrogen fixation means the uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere. ";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: The uptake of nitrogen by fixation: nitrogen fixation means the uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere.
Long name: Total Plant Nitrogen Uptake (Sum of Ammonium and Nitrate) Irrespective of the Source of Nitrogen

title: Variable land.mon.fNnetmin_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNnetmin)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Loss of soil nitrogen through remineralization and immobilisation. Remineralization is the degradation of organic matter into inorganic forms of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus and other micronutrients, which consumes oxygen and releases energy. Immobilisation of nitrogen refers to retention of nitrogen by micro-organisms under certain conditions, making it unavailable for plants.
Long name: Net Nitrogen Release from Soil and Litter as the Outcome of Nitrogen Immobilisation and Gross Mineralisation

title: Variable land.mon.fNloss_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNloss)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Not all models split losses into gaseous and leaching
Long name: Total Nitrogen Lost (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and Leaching)

title: Variable land.mon.fNleach_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNleach)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. 'Leaching' means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, 'runoff' refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Leaching" means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, "runoff" refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.
Long name: Total Nitrogen Loss to Leaching or Runoff (Sum of Ammonium, Nitrite and Nitrate)

title: Variable land.mon.fNgasNonFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNgasNonFire)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to all processes other than fire
Long name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from All Processes Except Fire

title: Variable land.mon.fNgasFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNgasFire)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to fire
Long name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from Fire

title: Variable land.mon.fNgas_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNgas)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.
Long name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)

title: Variable land.mon.fNfert_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNfert)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Total Nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure). Relative to total land area of a grid cell, not relative to agricultural area
Long name: Total Nitrogen Added for Cropland Fertilisation (Artificial and Manure)

title: Variable land.mon.fNdep_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNdep)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Surface deposition rate of nitrogen.
Long name: Dry and Wet Deposition of Reactive Nitrogen onto Land

title: Variable land.mon.fNVegSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNVegSoil)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: In some models part of nitrogen (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.
Long name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil

title: Variable land.mon.fNVegLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNVegLitter)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. 'Vegetation' means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass.
Long name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter

title: Variable land.mon.fNProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNProduct)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
Long name: Deforested or Harvested Biomass as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use or Change

title: Variable land.mon.fNOx_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNOx)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. 'Nox' means a combination of two radical species containing nitrogen and oxygen NO+NO2. 'Vegetation' means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. "Nox" means a combination of two radical species containing nitrogen and oxygen NO+NO2. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

title: Variable land.mon.fNLitterSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNLitterSoil)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.
Long name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Litter to Soil

title: Variable land.mon.fNLandToOcean_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNLandToOcean)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: leached nitrogen etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.
Long name: Lateral Transfer of Nitrogen out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean

title: Variable land.mon.fNAnthDisturb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fNAnthDisturb)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: will require some careful definition to make sure we capture everything - any human activity that releases nitrogen from land  instead of into product pool goes here. E.g. Deforestation fire, harvest assumed to decompose straight away, grazing...
Long name: Nitrogen Mass Flux out of Land Due to any Human Activity

title: Variable land.mon.fN2O_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fN2O)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Surface upward flux of nitrous oxide (N2O) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.

title: Variable land.mon.fLuc_tavg-u-hxy-lus (Emon.fLulccAtmLut)
Comment: This annual mean flux refers to the transfer of carbon directly to the atmosphere due to any land-use or land-cover change activities.  Include carbon transferred due to deforestation or agricultural directly into atmosphere, and  emissions form anthropogenic pools into atmosphere
Long name: Carbon Transferred Directly to Atmosphere Due to any Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Activities [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude time landUse,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable land.mon.fLuc_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fLuc)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to human changes to land (excluding forest regrowth) accounting possibly for different time-scales related to fate of the wood, for example.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Land Use Change
Long name: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.fLitterFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fLitterFire)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux from Litter, CWD or any non-Living Pool into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.fHarvestToProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fHarvestToProduct)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: be it food or wood harvest, any carbon that is subsequently stored is reported here
Long name: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool

title: Variable land.mon.fHarvestToAtmos_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fHarvestToAtmos)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: any harvested carbon that is assumed to decompose immediately into the atmosphere is reported here
Long name: Harvested Biomass That Goes Straight into Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.fFireNat_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fFireNat)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: CO2 emissions from natural fires
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Natural Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.fFireAll_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fFireAll)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: From all sources,  Including natural, anthropogenic and Land-use change. Only total fire emissions can be compared to observations.
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Including All Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.fDeforestToProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fDeforestToProduct)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
Long name: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change

title: Variable land.mon.fDeforestToAtmos_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fDeforestToAtmos)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
Long name: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Atmosphere as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.mon.fCLandToOcean_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fCLandToOcean)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: leached carbon etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.
Long name: Lateral Transfer of Carbon out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean

title: Variable land.mon.fBNF_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fBNF)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: The fixation (uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere) of nitrogen due to biological processes.

title: Variable land.mon.fAnthDisturb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.fAnthDisturb)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Anthropogenic flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. That is, emissions influenced, caused, or created by human activity. Anthropogenic emission of carbon dioxide includes fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change, except forest regrowth.
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation, Litter or Soil Pools into the Atmosphere Due to any Human Activity [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable ocnBgchem.mon.expcalc_tavg-l-hxy-sea (Emon.expcalc)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Downward flux of Calcite
Processing notes: Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

title: Variable land.mon.evspsblpot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Emon.evspsblpot)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: at surface; potential flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

title: Variable aerosol.mon.ec550aer_tavg-l-hxy-u (Emon.ec550aer)
Comment: Aerosol Extinction at 550nm

title: Variable ocnBgchem.mon.dissi14c_tavg-l-hxy-sea (Emon.dissi14c)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Dissolved inorganic carbon-14 (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

title: Variable aerosol.mon.depdust_tavg-u-hxy-u (Emon.depdust)
Comment: Fdry mass deposition rate of dust

title: Variable land.mon.cropFracC4_tavg-u-hxy-u (Emon.cropFracC4)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean";
Comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 crops

title: Variable land.mon.cropFracC3_tavg-u-hxy-u (Emon.cropFracC3)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean";
Comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 crops
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time typec3crop CMIP7:longitude latitude time  typec3crop,;  ; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean,

title: Variable atmos.mon.co2_tavg-u-hm-u (Emon.co2s)
CMIP6 Differences: "units" was "1e-06";
Comment: As co2, but only at the surface

title: Variable atmos.mon.co23D_tavg-l-hxy-u (Emon.co23D)

Comment: requested for all Emissions-driven runs

title: Variable land.mon.cnc_tavg-u-hxy-u (Emon.cnc)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean

title: Variable atmos.mon.clwmodis_tavg-u-hxy-u (Emon.clwmodis)

title: Variable atmos.mon.clmisr_tavg-h16-hxy-air (Emon.clmisr)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Cloud percentage in spectral bands and layers as observed by the Multi-angle Imaging SpectroRadiometer (MISR) instrument. The first layer in each profile is reserved for a retrieval error flag."; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Comment: MISR cloud area fraction
Long name: Percentage Cloud Cover as Calculated by the MISR Simulator (Including Error Flag)

title: Variable atmos.mon.climodis_tavg-u-hxy-u (Emon.climodis)

title: Variable atmos.mon.cldnvi_tavg-u-hxy-u (Emon.cldnvi)
Comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

title: Variable atmos.mon.cldncl_tavg-u-hxy-cl (Emon.cldncl)
Comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.
Long name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Cloud Tops

title: Variable atmos.mon.cldnci_tavg-u-hxy-cl (Emon.cldnci)
Comment: Concentration 'as seen from space' over ice-cloud portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.
Long name: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops

labels: day atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 BCV

Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. title: Variable land.day.wtd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.wtd)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Depth is the vertical distance below the surface. The water table is the surface below which the soil is saturated with water such that all pore spaces are filled.";

title: Variable atmos.day.vtendogw_tavg-p19-hxy-air (Eday.vtendogw)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Tendency of northward wind induced by the parameterized orographic gravity wave drag
Long name: Tendency of northward wind due to orographic gravity waves
Processing notes: This is the total tendency due to parameterized orographic gravity wave drag, which is the sum of all possible components of the parameterization (where applicable). We ask that in the Essential Model Documentation modelling centers specify the parameterization scheme used and the specific values of its tunable parameters used for the simulation, and a specification of the part of the gravity wave spectrum that is targeted by the parameterization (e.g., minimally, the effective resolution of the model).

This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. title: Variable land.day.nppVgt_tavg-u-hxy-lus (Eday.nppVgt)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.
Long name: Net Primary Production on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.day.mrro_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.mrro)

title: Variable ocean.day.mlotst_tavg-u-hxy-sea (Eday.mlotst)

title: Variable landIce.day.lwsnl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.lwsnl)

title: Variable land.day.lai_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.lai)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

title: Variable atmos.day.jpdftaureliqmodis_tavg-u-hxy-u (Eday.jpdftaureliqmodis)
CMIP6 Differences: "standard_name" was "cloud_area_fraction_in_atmosphere_layer"; ; "comment" was "Joint probability distribution function, giving probability of cloud as a function of optical thickness and particle size, as measured by MODIS. For liquid cloud particles.";

title: Variable atmos.day.jpdftaureicemodis_tavg-u-hxy-u (Eday.jpdftaureicemodis)

title: Variable landIce.day.hfdsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.hfdsn)

title: Variable land.day.gpp_tavg-u-hxy-lus (Eday.gppVgt)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.
Long name: Gross Primary Production on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable atmosChem.day.flashrate_tavg-u-hxy-u (Eday.flashrate)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Lightning Flash Rate
Processing notes: frequency of lightning flashes per unit area

title: Variable land.day.evspsblveg_tavg-u-hxy-u (Eday.evspsblveg)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: The same as the current variable evspsblveg but defined on daily timescales.
Long name: Daily water evaporation flux from canopy

title: Variable land.day.evspsblsoi_tavg-u-hxy-u (Eday.evspsblsoi)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Water evaporation flux from soil but for daily averages i.e., the evspsblsoi variable, which is only currently defined for monthly averages
Long name: Daily water evaporation flux from soil

title: Variable land.day.evspsblpot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.evspsblpot)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "at surface; potential flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: water_potential_evapotranspiration_flux

title: Variable land.day.evspsbl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.evspsbl)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Evaporation at surface (also known as evapotranspiration): flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

title: Variable land.day.esn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.esn)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Water here means water in all phases. Evaporation is the conversion of liquid or solid into vapor. (The conversion of solid alone into vapor is called 'sublimation'.) In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. Unless indicated in the cell_methods attribute, a quantity is assumed to apply to the whole area of each horizontal grid box. Previously, the qualifier where_type was used to specify that the quantity applies only to the part of the grid box of the named type.  Names containing the where_type qualifier are deprecated and newly created data should use the cell_methods attribute to indicate the horizontal area to which the quantity applies.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: liquid_water_evaporation_flux_from_surface_snow

title: Variable land.day.dsw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.dsw)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The phrase 'land_water_amount', often known as 'Terrestrial Water Storage', includes: surface liquid water (water in rivers, wetlands, lakes, reservoirs, rainfall intercepted by the canopy); surface ice and snow (glaciers, ice caps, grounded ice sheets not displacing sea water, river and lake ice, other surface ice such as frozen flood water, snow lying on the surface and intercepted by the canopy); subsurface water (liquid and frozen soil water, groundwater).";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean

title: Variable land.day.dsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.dsn)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Change in time of the mass per unit area of ice in glaciers, ice caps, ice sheets and shelves, river and lake ice, any other ice on a land surface, such as frozen flood water, and snow lying on such ice or on the land surface.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean

title: Variable land.day.dslw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.dslw)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The phrase 'change_over_time_in_X' means change in a quantity X over a time-interval, which should be defined by the bounds of the time coordinate. 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The mass content of water in soil refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including 'content_of_soil_layer' are used. 'Water' means water in all phases.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean

title: Variable land.day.drivw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.drivw)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Change over time of the mass of water per unit area in the fluvial system (stream and floodplain).";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean

title: Variable land.day.dgw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.dgw)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Groundwater is subsurface water below the depth of the water table.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: change_over_time_in_groundwater

title: Variable land.day.dcw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.dcw)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The phrase 'change_over_time_in_X' means change in a quantity X over a time-interval, which should be defined by the bounds of the time coordinate. 'Canopy' means the plant or vegetation canopy. Canopy water is the water on the canopy. 'Water' means water in all phases, including frozen, i.e. ice and snow. 'Amount' means mass per unit area.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: change_over_time_in_canopy_water_amount

title: Variable atmos.day.clwvic_tavg-u-hxy-u (Eday.clwvic)
Comment: calculate mass of convective condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

title: Variable atmos.day.clt_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (Eday.clt)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Total cloud fraction

title: Variable atmos.day.clivic_tavg-u-hxy-u (Eday.clivic)
Comment: calculate mass of convective ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

title: Variable atmos.day.cldnvi_tavg-u-hxy-u (Eday.cldnvi)
Comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

title: Variable atmos.day.cldnci_tavg-u-hxy-cl (Eday.cldnci)
Comment: Concentration 'as seen from space' over ice-cloud portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.
Long name: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops

title: Variable atmos.day.ccldncl_tavg-u-hxy-ccl (Eday.ccldncl)
CMIP6 Differences: "standard_name" was "number_concentration_of_convective_cloud_liquid_water_particle_at_convective_liquid_water_cloud_top";
Comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.
Long name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops
