title: Variable atmos.subhr.zg_tpt-l-hxys-u (CFsubhr.zg)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt";
Comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:subhrPt CMIP7:subhr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.subhr.tntmp_tpt-l-hxys-u (CFsubhr.tntmp)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Tendency of air temperature due to model physics. This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget."; ; "frequency" was "subhrPt";
Comment: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:subhrPt CMIP7:subhr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: (m01s14i181[lbproc=0]+ m01s01i181[lbproc=0] + m01s02i181[lbproc=0] + m01s03i181[lbproc=0] + m01s04i141[lbproc=0] + m01s04i181[lbproc=0] + m01s05i181[lbproc=0] + m01s06i181[lbproc=0] + m01s16i161[lbproc=0] + m01s16i181[lbproc=0] + m01s35i029[lbproc=0]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP

title: Variable atmos.subhr.tnhusmp_tpt-l-hxys-u (CFsubhr.tnhusmp)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt"; ; "comment" was "Tendency of specific humidity due to model physics. This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physics.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.";
Comment: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physicsl.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.
Long name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Model Physics

Expression HadGEM3-GC31: (m01s01i182[lbproc=0] + m01s02i182[lbproc=0] + m01s03i182[lbproc=0] + m01s04i142[lbproc=0] + m01s04i182[lbproc=0] + m01s04i982[lbproc=0] + m01s05i182[lbproc=0] + m01s16i162[lbproc=0] + m01s16i182[lbproc=0] + m01s35i025[lbproc=0] ) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP
Expression UKESM1: (m01s01i182[lbproc=0] + m01s02i182[lbproc=0] + m01s03i182[lbproc=0] + m01s04i142[lbproc=0] + m01s04i182[lbproc=0] + m01s04i982[lbproc=0] + m01s05i182[lbproc=0] + m01s16i162[lbproc=0] + m01s16i182[lbproc=0] + m01s35i025[lbproc=0] ) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP

title: Variable atmos.subhr.tnhusd_tpt-l-hxys-u (CFsubhr.tnhusd)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt"; ; "comment" was "Tendency of specific humidity due to numerical diffusion.This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.";
Comment: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.
Long name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Numerical Diffusion
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:subhrPt CMIP7:subhr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.subhr.rsus_tpt-u-hxys-u (CFsubhr.rsus)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics."; ; "frequency" was "subhrPt";
Comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
Processing notes: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:subhrPt CMIP7:subhr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.subhr.rlus_tpt-u-hxys-u (CFsubhr.rlus)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt"; ; "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";
Comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
Processing notes: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:subhrPt CMIP7:subhr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. title: Variable atmos.subhr.fco2nat_tpt-u-hxys-u (CFsubhr.fco2nat)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt"; ; "comment" was "This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon  that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land (nep) or ocean (fgco2) reservoirs.";
Comment: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L_mon and O_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., "net ecosystem biospheric productivity", for land, and "air to sea CO2 flux", for ocean.)
Long name: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures. Comment: Surface temperature of all surfaces except open ocean, sampled synoptically.

title: Variable atmos.subhr.ci_tpt-u-hxys-u (CFsubhr.ci)

Comment: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell .
Long name: Fraction of Time Convection Occurs in Cell
Processing notes: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures. title: Variable atmos.subhr.cct_tpt-u-hxys-u (CFsubhr.cct)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt";
Comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
Long name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
Processing notes: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:subhrPt CMIP7:subhr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.subhr.ccb_tpt-u-hxys-u (CFsubhr.ccb)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt";
Comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
Long name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
Processing notes: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures.  All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:subhrPt CMIP7:subhr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.mon.tntscpbl_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.tntscpbl)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing (to be specified only in  models which do not separate cloud, precipitation and boundary layer terms.  Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive ones.)";
Comment: To be specified only in  models which do not separate cloud, precipitation and boundary layer terms.  Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive ones.
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: (m01s03i181[lbproc=128] + m01s04i141[lbproc=128] + m01s04i181[lbproc=128] + m01s16i161[lbproc=128] + m01s16i181[lbproc=128] + m01s01i181[lbproc=128] - m01s01i161[lbproc=128] + m01s02i181[lbproc=128] - m01s02i161[lbproc=128] + m01s05i181[lbproc=128] - m01s05i161[lbproc=128]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP
Expression UKESM1: (m01s03i181[lbproc=128] + m01s04i141[lbproc=128] + m01s04i181[lbproc=128] + m01s16i161[lbproc=128] + m01s16i181[lbproc=128] + m01s01i181[lbproc=128] - m01s01i161[lbproc=128] + m01s02i181[lbproc=128] - m01s02i161[lbproc=128] + m01s05i181[lbproc=128] - m01s05i161[lbproc=128]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP

title: Variable atmos.mon.tntr_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.tntr)
Comment: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Radiative Heating
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Radiative Heating

title: Variable atmos.mon.tntmp_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.tntmp)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Tendency of air temperature due to model physics. This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.";
Comment: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: (m01s14i181[lbproc=128] + m01s01i181[lbproc=128] + m01s02i181[lbproc=128] + m01s03i181[lbproc=128] + m01s04i141[lbproc=128] + m01s04i181[lbproc=128] + m01s05i181[lbproc=128] + m01s06i181[lbproc=128] + m01s16i161[lbproc=128] + m01s16i181[lbproc=128] + m01s35i029[lbproc=128]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP
Expression UKESM1: (m01s14i181[lbproc=128] + m01s01i181[lbproc=128] + m01s02i181[lbproc=128] + m01s03i181[lbproc=128] + m01s04i141[lbproc=128] + m01s04i181[lbproc=128] + m01s05i181[lbproc=128] + m01s06i181[lbproc=128] + m01s16i161[lbproc=128] + m01s16i181[lbproc=128] + m01s35i029[lbproc=128]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP

title: Variable atmos.mon.tntc_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.tntc)
Comment: Tendencies from cumulus convection scheme.
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Convection

title: Variable atmos.mon.tnta_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.tnta)
Comment: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Advection

title: Variable atmos.mon.tnt_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.tnt)
Comment: Tendency of Air Temperature

title: Variable atmos.mon.tnhusscpbl_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.tnhusscpbl)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing  (to be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all boundary layer terms including and diffusive terms.)";
Comment: To be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all bounday layer terms including and diffusive terms.
Long name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: (m01s01i182[lbproc=128] + m01s02i182[lbproc=128] + m01s03i182[lbproc=128] + m01s04i142[lbproc=128] + m01s04i182[lbproc=128] + m01s05i182[lbproc=128] - m01s05i162[lbproc=128] + m01s16i162[lbproc=128] + m01s16i182[lbproc=128]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP
Expression UKESM1: (m01s01i182[lbproc=128] + m01s02i182[lbproc=128] + m01s03i182[lbproc=128] + m01s04i142[lbproc=128] + m01s04i182[lbproc=128] + m01s05i182[lbproc=128] - m01s05i162[lbproc=128] + m01s16i162[lbproc=128] + m01s16i182[lbproc=128]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP

title: Variable atmos.mon.tnhusmp_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.tnhusmp)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Tendency of specific humidity due to model physics. This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physics.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.";
Comment: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physicsl.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.
Long name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Model Physics
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: (m01s01i182[lbproc=128] + m01s02i182[lbproc=128] + m01s03i182[lbproc=128] + m01s04i142[lbproc=128] + m01s04i182[lbproc=128] + m01s04i982[lbproc=128] + m01s05i182[lbproc=128] + m01s16i162[lbproc=128] + m01s16i182[lbproc=128] + m01s35i025[lbproc=128] ) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP
Expression UKESM1: (m01s01i182[lbproc=128] + m01s02i182[lbproc=128] + m01s03i182[lbproc=128] + m01s04i142[lbproc=128] + m01s04i182[lbproc=128] + m01s04i982[lbproc=128] + m01s05i182[lbproc=128] + m01s16i162[lbproc=128] + m01s16i182[lbproc=128] + m01s35i025[lbproc=128] ) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP

title: Variable atmos.mon.tnhusd_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.tnhusd)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Tendency of specific humidity due to numerical diffusion.This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.";
Comment: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.
Long name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Numerical Diffusion

Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where cloud CMIP7:area: time: mean where cloud, area: time: mean where cloud copy,; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where cloud CMIP7:area: time: mean where cloud, area: time: mean where convective_cloud,; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where cloud CMIP7:area: time: mean where cloud, area: time: mean where convective_cloud,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.mon.mcu_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.mcu)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The atmosphere convective mass flux is the vertical transport of mass for a field of cumulus clouds or thermals, given by the product of air density and vertical velocity. For an area-average, cell_methods should specify whether the average is over all the area or the area of updrafts only.";
Comment: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).
Processing notes: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).

title: Variable atmos.mon.mcd_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.mcd)
Comment: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).
Processing notes: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).

title: Variable atmos.mon.hus_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.hus)
Comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

title: Variable atmos.mon.hur_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.hur)
Comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

title: Variable atmos.mon.evu_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.evu)
Comment: Vertical diffusion coefficient for momentum due to parametrised eddies

title: Variable atmos.mon.edt_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.edt)
Comment: Vertical diffusion coefficient for temperature due to parametrised eddies

title: Variable atmos.mon.dmc_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.dmc)
Comment: The net mass flux  represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.   This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).
Processing notes: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).

title: Variable atmos.mon.clwvimodis_tavg-u-hxy-u (CFmon.clwvimodis)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column) as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.

title: Variable atmos.mon.clws_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.clws)
Comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Long name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water

title: Variable atmos.mon.clwc_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.clwc)
Comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Long name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water

title: Variable atmos.mon.cltmodis_tavg-u-hxy-u (CFmon.cltmodis)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Percentage of total cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.
Processing notes: Latitude x longitude x time. NOTE: Both of the entries in _Coordinates_ and _Extra Dimensions_ should be ignored as they were only included for form submission.

title: Variable atmos.mon.cltisccp_tavg-u-hxy-u (CFmon.cltisccp)
Comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the International Satellite Cloud Climatology Project (ISCCP) analysis. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  (MODIS). Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

title: Variable atmos.mon.cltcalipso_tavg-u-hxy-u (CFmon.cltcalipso)
Comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the  Cloud-Aerosol Lidar and Infrared Pathfinder Satellite Observation (CALIPSO) instrument. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

title: Variable atmos.mon.cls_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.cls)
Comment: Cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column due to stratiform clouds, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

title: Variable atmos.mon.clmodisliquidReff_tavg-u-hxy-u (CFmon.clmodisliquidReff)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Percentage liquid-cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of LWP (cloud liquid water path) and r_eff (droplet effective radius).
Long name: MODIS Liquid Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Processing notes: 7 LWP levels x 6 effective radius levels.

title: Variable atmos.mon.clmodisliquid_tavg-p7c-hxy-air (CFmon.clmodisliquid)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Percentage liquid-cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same used by clisccp (ISCCP simulator).
Long name: MODIS Liquid Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Processing notes: 7 pressure levels x 7 optical depth levels.

title: Variable atmos.mon.clmodisiceReff_tavg-u-hxy-u (CFmon.clmodisiceReff)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Percentage ice-cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of cloud IWP (cloud ice water path) and r_eff (effective droplet size).
Long name: MODIS Ice Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Processing notes: 7 IWP levels x 6 effective radius levels.  Metric is further described in [Pincus 2023](https://essd.copernicus.org/articles/15/2483/2023/essd-15-2483-2023-discussion.html)

title: Variable atmos.mon.clmodisice_tavg-p7c-hxy-air (CFmon.clmodisice)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Percentage ice-cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same as used by clisccp output from the ISCCP satellite simulator.
Long name: MODIS Ice Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Processing notes: 7 pressure levels x 7 optical depth levels.

title: Variable atmos.mon.clmodis_tavg-p7c-hxy-air (CFmon.clmodis)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Percentage of total cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same used by the ISCCP instrument simulator. This is the equivalent MODIS version of the ISCCP _clisccp _variable.
Processing notes: 7 pressure levels x 7 optical depth levels (x latitude x longitude x time).

title: Variable atmos.mon.clcalipso_tavg-560hPa-hxy-air (CFmon.clmcalipso)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 560hPa
Long name: CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Cover Percentage
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where air,

title: Variable atmos.mon.clcalipso_tavg-840hPa-hxy-air (CFmon.cllcalipso)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 840hPa
Long name: CALIPSO Low Level Cloud Cover Percentage
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where air,

title: Variable atmos.mon.clivimodis_tavg-u-hxy-u (CFmon.clivimodis)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column) as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.

title: Variable atmos.mon.clisccp_tavg-p7c-hxy-air (CFmon.clisccp)
CMIP6 Differences: "standard_name" was "cloud_area_fraction_in_atmosphere_layer"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Comment: Percentage cloud cover in optical depth categories.
Processing notes: 7 levels x 7 tau. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where air,

title: Variable atmos.mon.clis_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.clis)
Comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Long name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice

title: Variable atmos.mon.clic_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFmon.clic)
Comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Long name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice

title: Variable atmos.mon.clcalipso_tavg-220hPa-hxy-air (CFmon.clhcalipso)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 220hPa

title: Variable atmos.day.zg_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFday.zg)
Comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

title: Variable atmos.day.mc_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFday.mc)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  The flux is computed as the mass divided by the area of the grid cell.";
Comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).
Processing notes: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).

title: Variable atmos.day.clwvi_tavg-u-hxy-u (CFday.clwvi)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.";
Comment: calculate mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

title: Variable atmos.day.clw_tavg-l-hxy-u (CFday.clw)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. Calculate as the mass of cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cells. Precipitating hydrometeors are included ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.";
Comment: Calculated as the mass of  cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Long name: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water

title: Variable atmos.day.cct_tavg-u-hxy-ccl (CFday.cct)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Cell methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area)
Comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
Long name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area),; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area), area: time: mean where stratifor (weighted by total convective cloud area) copy,; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area), area: time: mean where stratiform_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area),

title: Variable atmos.3hr.rlds_tpt-u-hxy-u (CF3hr.rlds)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "3hrPt"; ; "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean 'net downward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";
Comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:3hrPt CMIP7:3hr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

Comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
Processing notes: express as a percentage.  Normally, the relative humidity  should be reported at the 2 meter height; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time1 height2m CMIP7:longitude latitude time1  height2m, Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.dtaus_tpt-l-hxy-ccl (CF3hr.dtaus)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "3hrPt";
Comment: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:3hrPt CMIP7:3hr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.dtauc_tpt-l-hxy-ccl (CF3hr.dtauc)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "3hrPt";
Comment: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:3hrPt CMIP7:3hr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.clwvi_tpt-u-hxy-u (CF3hr.clwvi)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "3hrPt"; ; "comment" was "Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.";
Comment: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:3hrPt CMIP7:3hr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.clws_tpt-l-hxy-u (CF3hr.clws)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "3hrPt";
Comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Long name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:3hrPt CMIP7:3hr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.clwc_tpt-l-hxy-u (CF3hr.clwc)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "3hrPt";
Comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Long name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:3hrPt CMIP7:3hr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.clt_tpt-u-hxy-u (CF3hr.clt)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "3hrPt"; ; "comment" was "Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.";
Comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:3hrPt CMIP7:3hr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.clivi_tpt-u-hxy-u (CF3hr.clivi)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "3hrPt";
Comment: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:3hrPt CMIP7:3hr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.clis_tpt-l-hxy-u (CF3hr.clis)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "3hrPt"; ; "comment" was "Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.";
Comment: Calculate as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  Include precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Long name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:3hrPt CMIP7:3hr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.clic_tpt-l-hxy-u (CF3hr.clic)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "3hrPt";
Comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Long name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:3hrPt CMIP7:3hr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.mon.zg_tavg-p39-hy-air (AERmonZ.zg)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "longitude: mean time: mean";
Comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

title: Variable aerosol.mon.vt_tavg-100hPa-hy-air (AERmonZ.vt100)

Comment: Zonally averaged eddy temperature flux at 100hPa as monthly means derived from daily (or higher frequency) fields.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

title: Variable aerosol.mon.oh_tavg-p39-hy-air (AERmonZ.oh)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "longitude: mean time: mean";
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

title: Variable aerosol.mon.o3_tavg-p39-hy-air (AERmonZ.o3)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "longitude: mean time: mean";
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

title: Variable aerosol.mon.noy_tavg-p39-hy-air (AERmonZ.noy)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "longitude: mean time: mean";
Comment: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model); list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. NOy = N + NO + NO2 + NO3 + HNO3 + 2N2O5 + HNO4 + ClONO2 + BrONO2 Definition: Total reactive nitrogen; usually includes atomic nitrogen (N), nitric oxide (NO), NO2, nitrogen trioxide (NO3), dinitrogen radical (N2O5), nitric acid (HNO3), peroxynitric acid (HNO4), BrONO2, ClONO2 add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields
Long name: Total Reactive Nitrogen Volume Mixing Ratio
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_AIR * ((m01s51i002[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_NO) + (m01s51i003[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_NO3) + (2 * m01s51i005[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_N2O5) + (m01s51i006[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HO2NO2) + (m01s51i007[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HNO3) + (m01s51i013[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HONO) + (m01s51i025[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MEONO2) + (m01s51i048[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_BRONO2) + (m01s51i054[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_CLONO2) + (m01s51i058[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_NITROGEN) + (m01s51i996[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_NO2)) / m01s51i999[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192]
Expression UKESM1: MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_AIR * ((m01s51i002[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_NO) + (m01s51i003[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_NO3) + (2 * m01s51i005[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_N2O5) + (m01s51i006[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HO2NO2) + (m01s51i007[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HNO3) + (m01s51i013[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HONO) + (m01s51i025[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MEONO2) + (m01s51i048[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_BRONO2) + (m01s51i054[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_CLONO2) + (m01s51i058[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_NITROGEN) + (m01s51i996[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_NO2)) / m01s51i999[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192]

title: Variable aerosol.mon.cly_tavg-p39-hy-air (AERmonZ.cly)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "longitude: mean time: mean"; ; "comment" was "Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Cly = HCl + ClONO2 + HOCl + ClO + Cl + 2*Cl2O2 +2Cl2 + OClO + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic stratospheric chlorine (e.g., HCl, ClO) resulting from degradation of chlorine-containing source gases (CFCs, HCFCs, VSLS), and natural inorganic chlorine sources (e.g., sea salt and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields";
Comment: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Cly = HCl + ClONO2 + HOCl + ClO + Cl + 2\*Cl2O2 +2Cl2 + OClO + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic stratospheric chlorine (e.g., HCl, ClO) resulting from degradation of chlorine-containing source gases (CFCs, HCFCs, VSLS), and natural inorganic chlorine sources (e.g., sea salt and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields
Long name: Total Inorganic Chlorine Volume Mixing Ratio
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_AIR * ((m01s51i041[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_CHLORINE) + (m01s51i042[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_CLOX) + (2 * m01s51i043[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_CL2O2) + (m01s51i044[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_OCLO) + (m01s51i047[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_BRCL) + (m01s51i051[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HOCL) + (m01s51i054[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_CLONO2) + (m01s51i992[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HCL)) / m01s51i999[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192]
Expression UKESM1: MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_AIR * ((m01s51i041[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_CHLORINE) + (m01s51i042[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_CLOX) + (2 * m01s51i043[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_CL2O2) + (m01s51i044[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_OCLO) + (m01s51i047[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_BRCL) + (m01s51i051[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HOCL) + (m01s51i054[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_CLONO2) + (m01s51i992[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HCL)) / m01s51i999[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192]

title: Variable aerosol.mon.bry_tavg-p39-hy-air (AERmonZ.bry)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "longitude: mean time: mean"; ; "comment" was "Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Bry = Br + BrO + HOBr + HBr + BrONO2 + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic bromine (e.g., HBr and inorganic bromine oxides and radicals (e.g., BrO, atomic bromine (Br), bromine nitrate (BrONO2)) resulting from degradation of bromine-containing organic source gases (halons, methyl bromide, VSLS), and natural inorganic bromine sources (e.g., volcanoes, sea salt, and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields";
Comment: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Bry = Br + BrO + HOBr + HBr + BrONO2 + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic bromine (e.g., HBr and inorganic bromine oxides and radicals (e.g., BrO, atomic bromine (Br), bromine nitrate (BrONO2)) resulting from degradation of bromine-containing organicsource gases (halons, methyl bromide, VSLS), and natural inorganic bromine sources (e.g., volcanoes, sea salt, and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields
Long name: Total Inorganic Bromine Volume Mixing Ratio
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_AIR * ((m01s51i045[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_BROMINE) + (m01s51i047[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_BRCL) + (m01s51i048[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_BRONO2) + (m01s51i052[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HBR) + (m01s51i053[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HOBR) + (m01s51i994[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_BRO)) / m01s51i999[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192]
Expression UKESM1: MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_AIR * ((m01s51i045[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_BROMINE) + (m01s51i047[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_BRCL) + (m01s51i048[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_BRONO2) + (m01s51i052[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HBR) + (m01s51i053[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HOBR) + (m01s51i994[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_BRO)) / m01s51i999[blev=PLEV39, lbproc=192]

title: Variable atmos.mon.ztp_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.ztp)
CMIP6 Differences: "modeling_realm" was "aerosol";
Comment: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

title: Variable atmos.mon.zg_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.zg)
Comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

title: Variable aerosol.mon.wetss_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.wetss)
Comment: Deposition rate of sea salt aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes
Long name: Wet Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
Expression UKESM1: achem_emdrywet(MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_NACL, m01s38i241[lbproc=128] + m01s38i242[lbproc=128] + m01s38i265[lbproc=128] + m01s38i266[lbproc=128], cube2d=(m01s38i914[lbproc=128] + m01s38i923[lbproc=128]), sumlev='True', areadiv='True')

title: Variable aerosol.mon.wetso4_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.wetso4)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Deposition rate of sulfate aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes";
Comment: proposed name: tendency_of_atmosphere_mass_content_of_sulfate_dry_aerosol_due_to_wet_deposition
Expression UKESM1: achem_emdrywet(MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_SO4, m01s38i238[lbproc=128] + m01s38i239[lbproc=128] + m01s38i240[lbproc=128] + m01s38i261[lbproc=128] + m01s38i262[lbproc=128] + m01s38i263[lbproc=128] + m01s38i264[lbproc=128], cube2d=(m01s38i905[lbproc=128] + m01s38i911[lbproc=128] + m01s38i920[lbproc=128]), sumlev='True', areadiv='True')

title: Variable aerosol.mon.wetso2_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.wetso2)
Comment: Deposition rate of sulfur dioxide due to wet processes

title: Variable aerosol.mon.wetoa_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.wetoa)
Comment: Deposition rate of organic matter in aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes
Long name: Wet Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Total Organic Matter
Expression UKESM1: achem_emdrywet(ATOMIC_MASS_OF_C * CONV_C_ORGM, m01s38i248[lbproc=128] + m01s38i249[lbproc=128] + m01s38i250[lbproc=128] + m01s38i251[lbproc=128] + m01s38i271[lbproc=128] + m01s38i272[lbproc=128] + m01s38i273[lbproc=128] + m01s38i274[lbproc=128] + m01s38i275[lbproc=128], cube2d=(m01s38i907[lbproc=128] + m01s38i913[lbproc=128] + m01s38i922[lbproc=128]), sumlev='True', areadiv='True')

title: Variable aerosol.mon.wetnoy_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.wetnoy)

Expression UKESM1: achem_emdrywet(ATOMIC_MASS_OF_C, m01s38i243[lbproc=128] + m01s38i244[lbproc=128] + m01s38i245[lbproc=128] + m01s38i246[lbproc=128] + m01s38i267[lbproc=128] + m01s38i268[lbproc=128] + m01s38i269[lbproc=128] + m01s38i270[lbproc=128], cube2d=(m01s38i906[lbproc=128] + m01s38i912[lbproc=128] + m01s38i921[lbproc=128]), sumlev='True', areadiv='True')

title: Variable aerosol.mon.wa_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.wa)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "A velocity is a vector quantity. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). Upward air velocity is the vertical component of the 3D air velocity vector. The standard name downward_air_velocity may be used for a vector component with the opposite sign convention.";
Comment: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). Upward air velocity is the vertical component of the 3D air velocity vector. The standard name downward_air_velocity may be used for a vector component with the opposite sign convention.

Comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

title: Variable aerosol.mon.tactop_tavg-u-hxy-cl (AERmon.ttop)
Comment: cloud_top refers to the top of the highest cloud. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature.

title: Variable aerosol.mon.tropoz_tavg-u-hm-u (AERmon.tropoz)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Tropospheric ozone column, should be consistent with definition of tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp). Calculated at 0 degrees C and 1 bar, such that 1m = 1e5 DU.";
Comment: Tropospheric ozone column, should be consistent with definition of tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp).

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.tropo3ste_tavg-u-hm-u (AERmon.tropo3ste)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone in the troposphere. It represents the ozone volume mixing ratio in the troposphere that is considered to be stratospheric in origin. It should be consistent with the definition of tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere and non-zero positive values in the troposphere.
Long name: Tropospheric ozone volume mixing ratio due to stratosphere-troposphere exchange (STE)

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.tropdo3chm_tavg-u-hm-u (AERmon.tropdo3chm)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: This is the net chemical tendency of ozone in the troposphere. The distinction between the stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the definition of the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere.
Long name: Net Chemistry Tendency of O3 in troposphere

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.tropch4lossoh_tavg-u-hm-u (AERmon.tropch4lossoh)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane due to reaction with the hydroxy (OH) radical. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp).  It should have zero values in the stratosphere.
Long name: Tropospheric loss of methane by OH

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.tropch4loss_tavg-u-hm-u (AERmon.tropch4loss)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane by all chemical destruction. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp).  It should have zero values in the stratosphere.
Long name: Loss of Tropospheric Methane by all chemical destruction

title: Variable aerosol.mon.toz_tavg-u-hxy-u (AERmon.toz)

title: Variable aerosol.mon.mmraerh2o_tavg-l-hxy-u (AERmon.mmraerh2o)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Mass fraction is used in the construction mass_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). 'Aerosol' means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. 'Ambient_aerosol' means that the aerosol is measured or modelled at the ambient state of pressure, temperature and relative humidity that exists in its immediate environment. 'Ambient aerosol particles' are aerosol particles that have taken up ambient water through hygroscopic growth. The extent of hygroscopic growth depends on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles.";
Comment: Mass fraction is used in the construction mass_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). "Aerosol" means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. "Ambient_aerosol" means that the aerosol is measured or modelled at the ambient state of pressure, temperature and relative humidity that exists in its immediate environment. "Ambient aerosol particles" are aerosol particles that have taken up ambient water through hygroscopic growth. The extent of hygroscopic growth depends on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles.

Expression HadGEM3-GC31: ((m01s50i159[lbproc=128] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HCHO) + (m01s50i160[lbproc=128] * (2.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_C2H6)) + (m01s50i161[lbproc=128] * (3.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_C3H8)) + (m01s50i162[lbproc=128] * (3.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_ME2CO)) + (m01s50i163[lbproc=128] * (2.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MECHO)) + (m01s50i212[lbproc=128] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MEOH) + (m01s50i300[lbproc=128] * (5.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_ISOPRENE)) + (m01s50i301[lbproc=128] * (10.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MONOTERPENE))) * ATOMIC_MASS_OF_C
Expression UKESM1: ((m01s50i159[lbproc=128] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HCHO) + (m01s50i160[lbproc=128] * (2.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_C2H6)) + (m01s50i161[lbproc=128] * (3.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_C3H8)) + (m01s50i162[lbproc=128] * (3.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_ME2CO)) + (m01s50i163[lbproc=128] * (2.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MECHO)) + (m01s50i212[lbproc=128] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MEOH) + (m01s50i300[lbproc=128] * (5.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_ISOPRENE)) + (m01s50i301[lbproc=128] * (10.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MONOTERPENE))) * ATOMIC_MASS_OF_C

Here, mass refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available.  Integrate 3D chemical production and emission field vertically to 2d field.";
Comment: This is the sum of total emission of POA and total production of SOA (emipoa+chepsoa). "Mass" refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. title: Variable aerosol.mon.cod_tavg-u-hxy-cl (AERmon.cod)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation_wavelength or radiation_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. 'Cloud' means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.";
Comment: The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation_wavelength or radiation_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. "Cloud" means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.

title: Variable aerosol.day.cod_tavg-u-hxy-cl (AERday.cod)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation_wavelength or radiation_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. 'Cloud' means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.";
Comment: The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation_wavelength or radiation_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. "Cloud" means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.wppwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.wppwindsea)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just wind-sea waves.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.wppswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.wppswell)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just swell waves.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.wpp_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.wpp)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.wpdirwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.wpdirwindsea)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.wpdirswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.wpdirswell)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.wpdir_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.wpdir)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.wdirwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.wdirwindsea)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.wdirswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.wdirswell)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.wdir_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.wdir)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.swhwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.swhwindsea)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). It is derived from the wind-sea wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wind-sea wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.swhswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.swhswell)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This parameter is derived from all swell partitions of the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the components of the two-dimensional wave spectrum that are not under the influence of local wind.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.swhmax_tstat-u-hxy-sea (6hr.swhmax)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: maximum
Comment: Highest value of the significant wave height simulated within a given time range (e.g., daily or monthly). The significant wave height (swh) is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, swh is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.swh_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.swh)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.sdvo_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.sdvo)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: The northward component of the net drift velocity of ocean water caused by surface wind-sea waves. The Stokes drift velocity could be defined as the difference between the average Lagrangian flow velocity of a fluid parcel, and the average Eulerian flow velocity of the fluid at a fixed position.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.sduo_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.sduo)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: The eastward component of the net drift velocity of ocean water caused by surface wind-sea waves. The Stokes drift velocity could be defined as the difference between the average Lagrangian flow velocity of a fluid parcel, and the average Eulerian flow velocity of the fluid at a fixed position.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.mpwwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.mpwwindsea)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) of wind-sea waves only (i.e., local wind waves). In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.mpwswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.mpwswell)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) of swell waves only (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

title: Variable ocean.6hr.mpw_tavg-u-hxy-sea (6hr.mpw)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.rsus_tavg-u-hxy-u (3hr.rsus)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";
Comment: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

title: Variable ocean.3hr.rsntds_tavg-u-hxy-sea (3hr.rsntds)
