Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.rsds_tavg-u-hxy-u (3hr.rsds)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.";
Comment: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.rlus_tavg-u-hxy-u (3hr.rlus)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";
Comment: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.rlds_tavg-u-hxy-u (3hr.rlds)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean 'net downward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";
Comment: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.ps_tpt-u-hxy-u (3hr.ps)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "3hrPt"; ; "comment" was "surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates";
Comment: sampled synoptically to diagnose atmospheric tides, this is better than mean sea level pressure.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:3hrPt CMIP7:3hr,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.prsn_tavg-u-hxy-u (3hr.prsn)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "At surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase";
Comment: at surface.  Includes precipitation of all forms water in the solid phase.  This is the 3-hour mean snowfall flux.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.pr_tavg-u-hxy-u (3hr.pr)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "includes both liquid and solid phases";
Comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.  This is the 3-hour mean precipitation flux.

title: Variable land.3hr.mrsol_tpt-z10cm-hxy-lnd (3hr.mrsos)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The mass of water in all phases in the upper 10cm of the  soil layer."; ; "frequency" was "3hrPt";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: point
Comment: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.
Long name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
Processing notes: integrate over uppermost 10 cm; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time1 sdepth1 CMIP7:longitude latitude time1  sdepth1, ; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where land time: point CMIP7:area: mean where land time: point, area: mean where land time: point copy,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable land.3hr.mrsol_tavg-z1m-hxy-lnd (3hr.mrso10)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Soil moisture at 3hr but for 0-1m

title: Variable land.3hr.mrros_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (3hr.mrros)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: surface_runoff_flux

title: Variable land.3hr.mrro_tavg-u-hxy-lnd (3hr.mrro)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The total run-off (including drainage through the base of the soil model) per unit area leaving the land portion of the grid cell.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell, averaged over the 3-hour interval.

title: Variable ocean.3hr.mpw_tavg-u-hxy-sea (3hr.mpw)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.huss_tpt-h2m-hxy-u (3hr.huss)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Near-surface (usually, 2 meter) specific humidity."; ; "frequency" was "3hrPt";
Comment: This is sampled synoptically.
Processing notes: normally, report at 2 meters above the surface; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time1 height2m CMIP7:longitude latitude time1  height2m,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.hfss_tavg-u-hxy-u (3hr.hfss)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.";
Comment: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

title: Variable ocean.3hr.hfrunoffds_tavg-l-hxy-sea (3hr.hfrunoffds)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.
Long name: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
Processing notes: In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e., it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions). Include enough depth levels to represent the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe. Report on native horizontal grid. If a function of depth, perform online remapping to depth or pressure, if not native vertical grid.

title: Variable atmos.3hr.hfls_tavg-u-hxy-u (3hr.hfls)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";
Comment: This is the 3-hour mean flux.

title: Variable land.3hr.hfdsl_tavg-u-hxy-u (3hr.hfdsl)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Ground heat flux at 3hr

title: Variable ocean.3hr.hfds_tavg-u-hxy-sea (3hr.hfds)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any 'flux adjustment').
Long name: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface

title: Variable ocean.3hr.friver_tavg-u-hxy-sea (3hr.friver)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Long name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid.

title: Variable ocean.3hr.flandice_tavg-u-hxy-sea (3hr.flandice)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to land ice (runoff water from surface and base of land ice or melt from base of ice shelf or vertical ice front) into the ocean divided by the area ocean portion of the grid cell.
Long name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Land Ice

title: Variable ocean.3hr.ficeberg_tavg-l-hxy-sea (3hr.ficeberg)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Computed as the iceberg melt water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Long name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

title: Variable land.3hr.evspsblveg_tavg-u-hxy-u (3hr.evspsblveg)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Evaporation from canopy

title: Variable land.3hr.evspsblsoi_tavg-u-hxy-u (3hr.evspsblsoi)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Water evaporation from soil

title: Variable atmos.3hr.clt_tavg-u-hxy-u (3hr.clt)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.";
Comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is a 3-hour mean.

title: Variable atmos.mon.zg_tavg-p19-hxy-air (Amon.zg)
Comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

title: Variable atmos.mon.wap_tavg-p19-hxy-air (Amon.wap)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards)";
Comment: commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

title: Variable atmos.mon.vas_tavg-h10m-hxy-u (Amon.vas)
Comment: Northward component of the near surface wind
Processing notes: normally, the the wind component should be reported at the 10 meter height; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time height10m CMIP7:longitude latitude time  height10m,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.mon.va_tavg-p19-hxy-air (Amon.va)
Comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

title: Variable atmos.mon.uas_tavg-h10m-hxy-u (Amon.uas)
Comment: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind
Processing notes: normally, the the wind component should be reported at the 10 meter height; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time height10m CMIP7:longitude latitude time  height10m,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.mon.ua_tavg-p19-hxy-air (Amon.ua)
Comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

title: Variable atmos.mon.ts_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.ts)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere";
Comment: Surface temperature (skin for open ocean)

title: Variable atmos.mon.tauv_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.tauv)
Comment: Downward northward wind stress at the surface

title: Variable atmos.mon.tauu_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.tauu)
Comment: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface

title: Variable atmos.mon.tasmin_tstat-h2m-hxy-u (Amon.tasmin)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: min')"; ; "dimensions" was "longitude latitude time height2m";
Cell methods: area: mean time: minimum within days time: mean over days
Comment: monthly mean of the daily-minimum near-surface air temperature.
Processing notes: Normally, this should be reported at the 2 meter height. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time height2m CMIP7:longitude latitude time4 height2m,

title: Variable atmos.mon.tasmax_tstat-h2m-hxy-u (Amon.tasmax)
CMIP6 Differences: "dimensions" was "longitude latitude time height2m"; ; "comment" was "maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: max')";
Cell methods: area: mean time: maximum within days time: mean over days
Comment: monthly mean of the daily-maximum near-surface air temperature.
Processing notes: Normally, this should be reported at the 2 meter height.; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time height2m CMIP7:longitude latitude time4 height2m,

title: Variable atmos.mon.tas_tavg-h2m-hxy-u (Amon.tas)
labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
Comment: near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature
Processing notes: normally, the temperature should be reported at the 2 meter height

title: Variable atmos.mon.ta_tavg-p19-hxy-air (Amon.ta)
Comment: Air Temperature

title: Variable atmos.mon.sfcWind_tavg-h10m-hxy-u (Amon.sfcWind)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.";
Comment: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind
Processing notes: normally, the the wind  should be reported at the 10 meter height; ; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time height10m CMIP7:longitude latitude time  height10m,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.mon.sci_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.sci)
Comment: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.
Long name: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
Processing notes: For models with a distinct shallow convection scheme only.

title: Variable landIce.mon.sbl_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.sbl)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass per unit area from the surface resulting from their direct conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.";
Comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.
Long name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Processing notes: This differs from sbl appearing in table Limon in that the flux is averaged over the entire grid cell, not just the land portion.; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Modeling Realm - CMIP6:landIce CMIP7:ocean,

title: Variable atmos.mon.rtmt_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.rtmt)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model : I.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.";
Comment: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.
Long name: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model

title: Variable atmos.mon.rsutcs_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.rsutcs)
Comment: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

title: Variable atmos.mon.rsut_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.rsut)
Comment: at the top of the atmosphere

title: Variable atmos.mon.rsuscs_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.rsuscs)
Comment: Surface Upwelling Clear-sky Shortwave Radiation

title: Variable atmos.mon.rsus_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.rsus)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";
Comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.o3_tclm-p19-hxy-air (Amon.o3Clim)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "monC"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem";
Cell methods: area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Processing notes: If O3 does not vary from one year to the next, report 12 months, starting with January.   (Note: include all 12 months even if the values do not vary seasonally.)  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as tro3Clim, not tro3. If the O3 varies from one year to the next,  then report instead the field described in the previous table entry.  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:monC CMIP7:mon, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years CMIP7:area: mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years,

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.o3_tavg-p19-hxy-air (Amon.o3)
CMIP6 Differences: "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem";
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
Processing notes: If this does not change over time (except possibly to vary identically over each annual cycle), report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.n2o_tclm-u-hm-u (Amon.n2oglobalClim)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "monC"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years"; ; "units" was "1e-09"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem";
Cell methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean within years time: mean over years
Comment: Global mean Nitrous Oxide (N2O)
Long name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O
Processing notes: Report only for simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), in which the N2O does not vary from one year to the next. Report 12 monthly values, starting with January, even if the values do not vary seasonally.  When calling CMOR, identify this variable as ch4globalClim, not ch4global.  If N2O is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry before the previous one).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in CMIP7 Frequency - CMIP6:monC CMIP7:mon, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Units (from Physical Parameter) - CMIP6:1.00E-09 CMIP7:mol mol-1, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years CMIP7:height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean within years time: mean over years,

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.n2o_tavg-u-hm-u (Amon.n2oglobal)
CMIP6 Differences: "units" was "1e-09"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Cell methods: height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean
Comment: Global mean Nitrous Oxide (N2O)
Long name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O
Processing notes: For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If N2O is spatially nonuniform, omit this field, but report Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry before the previous one).   Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean,

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.n2o_tclm-p19-hxy-air (Amon.n2oClim)

Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

If  N2O is spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry after the next).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels? CMIP6 Differences: "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem";
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.
Processing notes: For some simulations (e.g., prescribed concentration pi-control run), this will not vary from one year to the next, and so report instead the variable described in the next table entry.  If N2O is spatially uniform, omit this field, but report Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O (see the table entry after the next one).  Are these the preferred units or should it be a unitless fraction?  Should this field be reported instead on model levels?  Or should we also require either the vertically integrated mole fraction (or mass?) of this species or the vertically integrated globally averaged mole fraction (or mass?)?

title: Variable atmos.mon.mc_tavg-l-hxy-u (Amon.mc)
Comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  The flux is computed as the mass divided by the area of the grid cell.
Processing notes: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).

title: Variable atmos.mon.huss_tavg-h2m-hxy-u (Amon.huss)
Comment: Near-surface (usually, 2 meter) specific humidity.
Processing notes: Normally, the specific humidity should be reported at the 2 meter height; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time height2m CMIP7:longitude latitude time  height2m,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.mon.hus_tavg-p19-hxy-u (Amon.hus)
Comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

title: Variable atmos.mon.hurs_tavg-h2m-hxy-u (Amon.hurs)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.";
Comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
Processing notes: express as a percentage.  Normally, the relative humidity  should be reported at the 2 meter height; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time height2m CMIP7:longitude latitude time  height2m,;  Changes since reverted/fixed. Variable now matches CMIP6 definition.

title: Variable atmos.mon.hur_tavg-p19-hxy-air (Amon.hur)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.";
Comment: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

title: Variable atmos.mon.hfss_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.hfss)
Comment: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

title: Variable atmos.mon.hfls_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.hfls)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";
Comment: includes both evaporation and sublimation

title: Variable atmosChem.mon.hcfc22_tavg-u-hm-u (Amon.hcfc22global)
CMIP6 Differences: "units" was "1e-12"; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos atmosChem"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Cell methods: height: area: time: mean (with all samples weighted by the number of moles of air in the sample)
Comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for HCFC22 is CHClF2.  The IUPAC name for HCFC22 is chloro-difluoro-methane.
Long name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of HCFC22
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:height: sum (through atmospheric column) area: sum time: mean,; CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Modeling Realm - primary - CMIP6:atmos, atmosChem CMIP7:atmosChem, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:height: area: time: mean (with all samples weighted by the number of moles of air in the sample),

title: Variable atmos.mon.fco2nat_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.fco2nat)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon  that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land (nep) or ocean (fgco2) reservoirs.";
Comment: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L_mon and O_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., "net ecosystem biospheric productivity", for land, and "air to sea CO2 flux", for ocean.)
Long name: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: Report from all simulations (both emission-driven and concentration-driven) performed by models with fully interactive and responsive carbon cycles.

title: Variable atmos.mon.fco2fos_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.fco2fos)
Comment: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.

title: Variable atmos.mon.fco2antt_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.fco2antt)
Comment: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable atmos.mon.evspsbl_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.evspsbl)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Evaporation at surface (also known as evapotranspiration): flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)";
Comment: at surface; flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

title: Variable atmos.mon.clwvi_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.clwvi)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.";
Comment: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

title: Variable atmos.mon.clw_tavg-l-hxy-u (Amon.clw)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. Calculate as the mass of cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cells. Precipitating hydrometeors are included ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.";
Comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  Calculate as the mass of cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cells. Precipitating hydrometeors are included ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Long name: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
Processing notes: Report on model layers (not standard pressures).

title: Variable atmos.mon.clt_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.clt)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.";
Comment: for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.

title: Variable atmos.mon.clivi_tavg-u-hxy-u (Amon.clivi)
Comment: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

title: Variable atmos.mon.cli_tavg-l-hxy-u (Amon.cli)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. This is calculated as the mass of cloud ice in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell. It includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.";
Comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  This is calculated as the mass of cloud ice in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell. It includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Processing notes: Report on model layers (not standard pressures).

title: Variable atmos.mon.cl_tavg-l-hxy-u (Amon.cl)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Percentage cloud cover, including both large-scale and convective cloud.";
Comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.
Processing notes: Report on model layers (not standard pressures).

title: Variable atmos.mon.cct_tavg-u-hxy-ccl (Amon.cct)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Cell methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area)
Comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
Long name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
